original_statement: My son started college.  We loaded up both of our cars with all of his things and headed to his college which was 3 hours away. I had to say my goodbyes in a gas station parking lot which was less than ideal.  We managed to fit all of his stuff except his bike into one car and I drove back home in case something major was wrong with the car.  My wife finished driving him to school to unload all of his stuff.  My oldest daughter went with them to help but we didn't have room in that car for my younger daughter who I drove home.
para_statement: My son began his journey to college. We packed both cars with all his belongings and drove to his college, which was three hours away. I had to say goodbye at a gas station, which wasn't the best setting. We managed to cram all his items except for his bike in one car, and I turned back in case the car issue worsened. My wife took over driving him to campus for unloading. My eldest daughter accompanied them to assist, but there wasn't enough space for my younger daughter, so she rode home with me.
